data.name: InitializeDatabaseText
data.value: Would you like to initialize the ArchiveService database? If you already have an ArchiveService database set up, this action will CLEAR it. If you do not have the database, you must initialize it for Archive Service to work properly.

data.name: InitializeDatabaseTitle
data.value: Initialize Database

data.name: OSQLEXEFailed
data.value: OSQL.exe failed to run properly on the file specified with the current user's permissions.

data.name: PleaseWaitDatabase
data.value: Please wait while the database initializes. This may take several minutes...

data.name: PleaseWaitStoredProcedures
data.value: Please wait while the stored procedures are created...

data.name: RunDropDatabaseSQL
data.value: Failed to drop Archive Service database. Please run DropDatabase.sql using your database tools (osql.exe, in the tools directory). Exception: {0}

data.value: Service Start Failure

data.name: SQLDataDirectoryError
data.value: The SQL Server data directory could not be found.

data.name: SqlServerNotFoundText
data.value: Microsoft SQL Server was not detected on this computer. Be sure to create the database by executing AddDatabase.sql and AddSPs.sql. You must edit the SqlConnectionString in the ArchiveWindowsService.exe.config file and restart the service. Be advised that connecting Archive Service to SQL Server on another server will adversely affect performance.

data.name: SqlServerNotFoundTitle
data.value: SQL Server Not Found
